question: 目次
sourceMnemonic: Your <kanji>eye</kanji> is on what's <kanji>next</kanji>. How is this possible to see what's coming up? That's because you're looking at a <vocabulary>table of contents</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The readings are the on'yomi readings, but you learned the kun'yomi reading for <ja>目</ja> before. So, you have to remember that this word uses <ja>もく</ja> instead of <ja>め</ja>. To do that, imagine yourself looking at a <vocabulary>table of contents</vocabulary>. Instead of being a normal table of contents there, it's just line after line of text trying to <reading>mock</reading> (<ja>もく</ja>) you. Come up with what those lines are and think about how you're being mocked.
